clinical_study.brief_title: Balance Training for Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
clinical_study.official_title: Balance Training for COPD in Pulmonary Rehabilitation (PR): An Effectiveness Study

brief_summary.textblock: The study will involve direct knowledge translation of a laboratory-based study of balance training for patients with COPD, first to the investigators PR program and then, after disseminating the results, this approach could be used to impact on clinical practice in any PR program.

primary_outcome.description: The BBS was assessed following completion of the balance training which took place thrice weekly for a period of 6 weeks.
The TUG was assessed following completion of the balance training which took place thrice weekly for a period of 6 weeks.

secondary_outcome.description: The BESTest was assessed following completion of the balance training which took place thrice weekly for a period of 6 weeks.
The ABC scale was assessed following completion of the balance training which took place thrice weekly for a period of 6 weeks.

other_outcome.measure: Balance training progression: the training prescription and progression will be recorded

other_outcome.description: Patients completed a questionnaire following completion of the balance training which took place thrice weekly for a period of 6 weeks. The focus group was conducted at the end of study recruitment.

other_outcome.measure: Safety: any adverse events associated with balance training will be recorded

other_outcome.description: The 6MWT was assessed by the physiotherapists responsible for delivering the PR program. The PR programs runs over 6 weeks.

intervention.description: Training will consist of 30 minute sessions 2-3 times/week for a total of 18-24 sessions, in keeping with best practice guidelines for older adults.12 Sessions will be supervised by physical therapists, using a circuit training approach with different stations designed to target specific areas of impairment. Participants will work through stations in a group setting; however, will receive individualized exercise prescription regarding level of difficulty and exercise progression.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with COPD enrolled in PR

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of COPD
- Self-report of decline in balance or fall in the last 5 years or a recent near fall
- Smoking history greater than 10 pack years
- Are able to provide written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- An inability to communicate because of language skills, hearing or cognitive impairment
- Evidence of a neurological or musculoskeletal condition that severely limits mobility and postural control (e.g., cerebrovascular accident, advanced Parkinson's disease, amputation).
